page.title: 05TWEEDMOUTH DOCK
page.content: The Tweed Dock has been open for over 100 years.It is run by a group of people known as the BERWICK HARBOUR COMMISSIONERS.The largest ship that can enter the dock is 70 metres long or 700 tonnes dead weight.The restriction in size is caused by the narrow entrance gate.The dock has 1,550 feet of quay frontage.The berthing fee is Â£19 per 100tons or Â£100 per week. In the summer there are 4 or 5 ships that enter the docks, while in winter the number is reduced to3 ships per week. There are 4 full time dockers employed. EXPORTS IMPORTS BARLEY N.W.EUROPE TIMBER SWEDEN WHEAT EUROPE FERTILISER FRANCE STONE LONDON/HOLLAND & N.IRELAND Trade has increased in recent years with improved efficiency.Pleasure craft and fishing boats use the dock.
